instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924A Liquid Damage
threads.message: Most of the corrosion was in the area of Q7310 (legs and pads are gone on one side) & Q7311, and a small amount on the other side near C5629.  Board has been UC'd.  How to handle missing pads for Q7310?

threads.title: 820-4924A Liquid Damage
threads.message: Does the board work? If no, replace all of those fets and U7200 and pray the CPU survived....

threads.title: 820-4924A Liquid Damage
threads.message:
All these pads are surrounded by continuous copper trace.
Be sure to have good contact for bigger pad underneath the MOSFET.
You don't even neeed to resolder these pins.
Check diode mode on CPU coils and compare with a good board.

Is VERY important to have good contact for Gate pins of all MOSFETs.
